001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import org.slf4j.Logger;
004import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
005
006import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext;
007import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
008import javax.net.ssl.TrustManager;
009import javax.net.ssl.TrustManagerFactory;
010import javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager;
011import java.io.FileInputStream;
012import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.io.InputStream;
015import java.nio.file.Path;
016import java.security.KeyManagementException;
017import java.security.KeyStore;
018import java.security.KeyStoreException;
019import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
020import java.security.cert.CertificateException;
021import java.security.cert.X509Certificate;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Arrays;
024import java.util.List;
025
026/**
027 * A Trust Manager that adds a second trust store (key store) to the default trust store.
028 * See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48790981/load-java-trust-store-at-runtime-after-jvm-have-been-launched/58695061#58695061
029 */
030public class CompositeTrustManager implements X509TrustManager {
031    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(CompositeTrustManager.class);
032    private static final char[] password = new char[]{'c','h','a','n','g','e','i','t'};
033
034    private final List<X509TrustManager> trustManagerList;
035
036    /**
037     * @param trustStoreStream Input stream for Java keystore with additional certificates
038     */
039    public CompositeTrustManager(InputStream trustStoreStream) {
040        List<X509TrustManager> trustManagers = new ArrayList<>();
041        try {
042            trustManagers.add(getCustomTrustManager(trustStoreStream));
043            trustManagers.add(getDefaultTrustManager());
044        } catch (Exception e) {
045            log.error("Exception: ", e);
046            throw new RuntimeException(e);
047        } finally {
048            try {
049                trustStoreStream.close();
050            } catch (IOException e) {
051                log.error("Exception: ", e);
052            }
053        }
054        trustManagerList = trustManagers;
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * @param trustStorePath Path to a Java keystore with additional certificates
059     * @throws FileNotFoundException If the file doesn't exist
060     */
061    public CompositeTrustManager(Path trustStorePath) throws FileNotFoundException {
062        this(new FileInputStream(trustStorePath.toFile()));
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Used to create an SSLSocketFactory using {@link CompositeTrustManager}
067     * See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/859111/how-can-i-use-different-certificates-on-specific-connections
068     */
069    public static SSLSocketFactory getCompositeSSLSocketFactory(Path trustStorePath) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, FileNotFoundException {
070        TrustManager tm = new CompositeTrustManager(trustStorePath);
071        return getSocketFactory(tm);
072    }
073
074
075    public static SSLSocketFactory getCompositeSSLSocketFactory(InputStream trustStoreStream) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException {
076        TrustManager tm = new CompositeTrustManager(trustStoreStream);
077        return getSocketFactory(tm);
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Create an SSLSocketFactory using an alternative Trust Store
082     */
083    public static SSLSocketFactory getAlternateSSLSocketFactory(Path trustStorePath) throws KeyStoreException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, CertificateException {
084        return getAlternateSSLSocketFactory(new FileInputStream(trustStorePath.toFile()));
085    }
086
087    /**
088     *
089     * @param trustStoreStream inputStream with Trust Store (password must be 'changeit')
090     * @return
091     */
092    public static SSLSocketFactory getAlternateSSLSocketFactory(InputStream trustStoreStream) throws KeyStoreException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, CertificateException {
093        X509TrustManager trustManager = getCustomTrustManager(trustStoreStream);
094        return getSocketFactory( trustManager );
095    }
096
097    private static SSLSocketFactory getSocketFactory(TrustManager trustManager) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException {
098        SSLContext ctx = SSLContext.getInstance("TLS");
099        ctx.init(null, new TrustManager[] {trustManager}, null);
100        return ctx.getSocketFactory();
101    }
102
103    @Override
104    public void checkClientTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType) throws CertificateException {
105        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
106            try {
107                trustManager.checkClientTrusted(chain, authType);
108                return;
109            } catch (CertificateException e) {
110                // maybe the next trust manager will trust it, don't break the loop
111            }
112        }
113        throw new CertificateException("None of the TrustManagers trust this certificate chain");
114    }
115
116    @Override
117    public void checkServerTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType) throws CertificateException {
118        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
119            try {
120                trustManager.checkServerTrusted(chain, authType);
121                return;
122            } catch (CertificateException e) {
123                // maybe the next trust manager will trust it, don't break the loop
124            }
125        }
126        throw new CertificateException("None of the TrustManagers trust this certificate chain");
127    }
128
129    @Override
130    public X509Certificate[] getAcceptedIssuers() {
131        List<X509Certificate> certs = new ArrayList<>();
132        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
133            certs.addAll(Arrays.asList(trustManager.getAcceptedIssuers()));
134        }
135        return certs.toArray(new X509Certificate[0]);
136    }
137
138    private static X509TrustManager getCustomTrustManager(InputStream trustStream) throws CertificateException, KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, IOException {
139        return createTrustManager(trustStream);
140    }
141
142    private static X509TrustManager getDefaultTrustManager() throws CertificateException, KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, IOException {
143        return createTrustManager(null);
144    }
145
146    private static X509TrustManager createTrustManager(InputStream trustStream) throws KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, CertificateException, IOException {
147        // Now get trustStore
148        KeyStore trustStore = KeyStore.getInstance(KeyStore.getDefaultType());
149
150        // load the stream to your store
151        trustStore.load(trustStream, password);
152
153        // initialize a trust manager factory with the trusted store
154        TrustManagerFactory trustFactory = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance(TrustManagerFactory.getDefaultAlgorithm());
155        trustFactory.init(trustStore);
156
157        // get the trust managers from the factory
158        TrustManager[] trustManagers = trustFactory.getTrustManagers();
159        for (TrustManager trustManager : trustManagers) {
160            if (trustManager instanceof X509TrustManager) {
161                return (X509TrustManager) trustManager;
162            }
163        }
164        throw new CertificateException("No X509TrustManager available");
165    }
166}
